title: How to Draw a Dolphin

steps.headline: Start with drawing an aerofoil shape, resembling like that part found in airplanes.
Draw an oblong tilted upper right at the top part of the aerofoil.
Add the snout of the dolphin or its mouth from crate.
Draw the tail using a triangle as a framework at the bottom of the aerofoil.
Refine the tail by using curves and draw the dolphin’s eyes.
Draw a curve that looks a bit like a cursive lowercase letter “r”.
Draw a U shape where the top right joins the previous line.
Join the top right of the U to the bottom of the first line you just drew.
steps.description: Then mimic the shape just below to create the stomach of the dolphin.

steps.headline: Add a dorsal fin on the back of the dolphin that looks line a slanted lowercase “n”.
Draw the tail, which is like a cross between a boomerang and an upside-down heart.
Add a U shape inside the dolphin for a flipper.
Draw a mouth and eye to complete your dolphin.

text: Drawing a Traditional Dolphin Start with drawing an aerofoil shape, resembling like that part found in airplanes.  Draw an oblong tilted upper right at the top part of the aerofoil.  Add the snout of the dolphin or its mouth from crate.  Draw the tail using a triangle as a framework at the bottom of the aerofoil.  Refine the tail by using curves and draw the dolphin’s eyes.  Trace with a pen. Erase unnecessary lines. Color to your liking!  Drawing a Cartoon Dolphin Draw a curve that looks a bit like a cursive lowercase letter “r”.  Draw a U shape where the top right joins the previous line.  Join the top right of the U to the bottom of the first line you just drew. Then mimic the shape just below to create the stomach of the dolphin. Add a dorsal fin on the back of the dolphin that looks line a slanted lowercase “n”.  Draw the tail, which is like a cross between a boomerang and an upside-down heart.  Add a U shape inside the dolphin for a flipper.  Draw a mouth and eye to complete your dolphin.
sentences: Drawing a Traditional Dolphin Start with drawing an aerofoil shape, resembling like that part found in airplanes.
Draw an oblong tilted upper right at the top part of the aerofoil.
Add the snout of the dolphin or its mouth from crate.
Draw the tail using a triangle as a framework at the bottom of the aerofoil.
Refine the tail by using curves and draw the dolphin’s eyes.
Drawing a Cartoon Dolphin Draw a curve that looks a bit like a cursive lowercase letter “r”.
Draw a U shape where the top right joins the previous line.
Join the top right of the U to the bottom of the first line you just drew.
Then mimic the shape just below to create the stomach of the dolphin.
Add a dorsal fin on the back of the dolphin that looks line a slanted lowercase “n”.
Draw the tail, which is like a cross between a boomerang and an upside-down heart.
Add a U shape inside the dolphin for a flipper.
Draw a mouth and eye to complete your dolphin.
